metadata.dc:author: Rodríguez-Rubio Cortadellas, F I
Robles García, J E
Martín-Marquina Aspiunza, A

Sanz Pérez, G
Díez-Caballero Alonso, F
metadata.dc:description: Presentation of 11 cases of retroperitoneal sarcoma. Mean time from the beginning of symptoms to diagnosis is 6 months. The primary complementary study is CT. Surgery was performed in all cases, using complete resection in 6 cases, and partial resection in 5. Ten patients relapsed. 9 of which were treated with surgical rescue, in one or more occasions; chemotherapy was added in 6 cases and radiotherapy in 7. Survival at five years is 68%, with a mean follow-up of 66 months.
metadata.dc:title: Sarcomas retroperitoneales.
[Retroperitoneal sarcomas].
